sen.j: たたきとは、主に魚を料理するときの調理法である。
sen.e: Tataki is a cooking method used mainly for preparing fish.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Tataki is a cooking method used mainly for preparing fish.
Tataki is a cooking method used mainly for preparing fish.

sen.j: 一般的には2つの大きく異なった調理法を指す。
sen.e: In general, it refers to two very different methods of cooking.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In general, it refers to the two very different methods of cooking.
In general, it refers to two very different methods of cooking.

sen.j: 食材をブロック状に切り、数本の串を打って火の上に翳す。
sen.e: The food ingredient is cut into blocks, pierced with some skewers and placed over the flame.
The food ingredient is cut into blocks, pierced with some skewers and placed over the flame.
The food ingredient is cut into blocks, pierced with some skewers and placed over the flame.

sen.j: 表面を軽く焼く程度にとどめ、中には火を通さない。
sen.e: Only the surface of the food is lightly seared, and the interior is not cooked.
Only the surface of the food is lightly seared, and the interior is not cooked.
Only the surface of the food is lightly seared, and the inside is not cooked.

sen.j: これを切り分け、ハーブや調味料をつけて食べる。
sen.e: This is cut and eaten with herbs and seasonings.
This is cut and eaten with herbs and seasonings.
This is cut and eaten with herbs and seasonings.

sen.j: 火であぶり、刺身状態にした鰹に、タレをたたくようにし、タレを馴染ませたことが「たたき」の由来。
sen.e: The word 'tataki' originates from patting sauce onto the bonito that has been seared and prepared like sashimi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The word 'tataki' originates from patting sauce onto the bonito that has been seared and prepared like sashimi.
The word 'tataki' originates from patting sauce onto the bonito that has been seared and prepared like sashimi.

sen.j: 手を皿のようにしてタレを入れて、タレを指の隙間から滴り落とす。
sen.e: The sauce is poured into the hand that acts as a plate, and the sauce is allowed to drip through the fingers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The sauce is poured into the hand that acts as a plate, and the sauce is allowed to drip through the fingers.
The sauce is poured into the hand that acts as a plate, and the sauce is allowed to drip through the fingers.

sen.j: この方法で調理する食材としては、魚の場合ほぼカツオに限られる。
sen.e: The ingredient used for this cooking method is usually limited to bonito in the case of fishes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The ingredient used for this cooking method is usually limited to bonito in the case of fishes.
The ingredient used for this cooking method is usually limited to bonito when it comes to fish.

sen.j: しかし、マグロや鮭、うつぼ料理うつぼのタタキで作られる場合もある。
sen.e: However, in some cases tuna, salmon and moray eels are used to make tataki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, in some cases, tuna, salmon and moray eels are used to make tataki.
However, in some cases, tuna, salmon and moray eels are used to make tataki.

sen.j: 特にカツオは傷みが早く、表面を炙ることにより殺菌効果が期待出来る。
sen.e: Bonito, in particular, spoils quickly, and therefore broiling of the surface is expected to kill bacteria.
Bonito, in particular, spoils quickly, and therefore broiling the surface is expected to kill bacteria.
Bonito, in particular, spoils quickly, and therefore broiling the surface is expected to kill bacteria.

sen.j: カツオのたたきは、四国、九州、紀州、遠州など鰹節の産地が本場として有名である（鰹のタタキ参照）。
sen.e: Areas that produce dried bonito, such as Shikoku, Kyushu, Kishu and Enshu, are famous for being home to bonito tataki (refer to Bonito Tataki).
Areas that produce dried bonito, such as Shikoku, Kyushu, Kishu and Enshu, are famous for being home to bonito tataki (refer to Bonito Tataki).
Areas that produce dried bonito, such as Shikoku, Kyushu, Kishu and Enshu, are famous for being home to bonito tataki (refer to Bonito Tataki).

sen.j: 市販品の中には、焼く代わりに油通ししたものもある。
sen.e: Among those that are sold at stores, there are some that are quick-fried instead of broiled.
Among those that are sold at stores, there are some that are quick-fried instead of broiled.
Among those that are sold at stores, there are some that are quick-fried instead of broiled.

sen.j: 家庭ではコンロの火で焼くことが多い。
sen.e: At home, the food is often broiled over the flames of a gas stove.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処、原文にはありませんが、訳文には主語(food)を追加しました。
sen.e: At home, the food is often broiled over the flames of a gas stove.
At home, the food is often broiled over the flames of a gas stove.

sen.j: しかし、藁を燃やした火やマツ葉を燃やした火、または炭火で焼くと、ガスの臭いがつかず独特の香ばしさがつき、より美味しい。
sen.e: However, if it is broiled over a flame made by burning rice straw, pine needles or over charcoal there will be no taste of the gas, and unique flavor will be added, making it tastier.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, if it is broiled over a flame made by burning rice straw, pine needles or over charcoal, there will be no taste of the gas, and unique flavor will be added, making it tastier.
sen.cmt: charcoal の後にカンマNC_CheckCould 'flavor' be 'aroma'?
sen.e: However, if it is broiled over a flame made by burning rice straw, pine needles or over charcoal, there will be no taste of gas, and a unique flavor will be brought out, making it tastier.

sen.j: カツオの場合、皮の方を先に焼くのがきれいに焼き上げるコツである。
sen.e: In the case of bonito tataki, the trick to a beautifully broiled finish is to cook the skin side first.
In the case of bonito tataki, the trick to a beautifully broiled finish is to cook the skin side first.
In the case of bonito tataki, the trick to a beautifully broiled finish is to cook the skin side first.

sen.j: また、焼いた直後に氷水につけるなどして急速に冷やすと身が引き締まっておいしくなる。
sen.e: In addition, if the food is cooled very quickly by plunging it in ice water immediately after broiling, the flesh will become firm and flavorful.
In addition, if the food is cooled very quickly by plunging it in ice water immediately after broiling, the flesh will become firm and flavorful.
sen.cmt: it の前のスペース短縮NC_Check
sen.e: In addition, if the food is cooled very quickly by plunging it into ice water suddenly after broiling, the flesh will become firm and flavorful.

sen.j: カツオの他には、牛肉で作ることもある。
sen.e: Besides bonito, it can also be made with beef.
Besides bonito, it can also be made with beef.
Besides using bonito, it can also be made with beef.

sen.j: ローストビーフの内部の肉はピンク色のため、二つの料理に類似性を見る人もいる。
sen.e: The interior of a roast beef is pink, and therefore some people see a similarity between the two dishes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The interior of a roast beef is pink, and therefore some people see a similarity between the two dishes.
The interior of the roast beef is pink, and therefore some people see a similarity between the two dishes.

sen.j: しかし、ローストビーフはオーブンの特性により実際は内部まで火が通っている。
sen.e: However, because of the property of the oven the inside of the roast beef is cooked.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, because of the property of the oven the inside of the roast beef is cooked.
However, because of the property of the oven the inside of the roast beef is cooked.

sen.j: 同様に馬肉や新鮮なニワトリのササミでも作られる。
sen.e: It is also made in a similar manner with horse meat and fresh chicken tenders.
It is also made in a similar manner with horse meat and fresh chicken tenders.
It is also made in a similar manner with horse meat and fresh chicken.

sen.j: 食べる際には、ショウガ、ニンニク、大根おろし、ネギなどが薬味として用いられる。
sen.e: It is served with condiments such as ginger, garlic, grated daikon radish and scallions.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is served with condiments such as ginger, garlic, grated daikon radish and leeks.
It is served with condiments such as ginger, garlic, grated daikon radish and leeks.

sen.j: すだちなどの柑橘類の汁で酸味をつけた醤油たれやポン酢をつけることが多い。
sen.e: It is often dipped in ponzu sauce or soy sauce made tangy with juices from citrus fruits, such as citrus sudachi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is often dipped in ponzu sauce or soy sauce made tangy with juice from citrus fruits, such as citrus sudachi.
It is often dipped in ponzu sauce or soy sauce made tangy with juice from citrus fruits, such as citrus sudachi.

sen.j: 焼いた食材に薬味をまぶしてから、包丁の腹などで叩いて身をしめることもある。
sen.e: Sometimes the broiled ingredient is sprinkled with condiments and then patted with the flat side of the knife to firm up the flesh.
Sometimes the broiled ingredient is sprinkled with condiments and then patted with the flat side of the knife to firm up the flesh.
Sometimes the broiled ingredient is sprinkled with condiments and then patted with the flat side of the knife to firm up the flesh.

sen.j: 食材を1-2cm角程度の大きさに切り、香草や味噌などを乗せる。
sen.e: The ingredient is chopped into 1 to 2-cm cubes and topped with herbs or miso.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The ingredient is chopped into 1 to 2-cm cubes and topped with herbs or miso.
The meat or fish is chopped into 1 to 2-cm cubes and topped with herbs or miso.

sen.j: それらを混ぜながら包丁で叩くよう細かく切り刻む。
sen.e: It is then minced into small pieces by beating with a knife.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is then minced into small pieces by beating with a knife.
It is then minced into small pieces by cutting it with a knife.

sen.j: ときには2本の包丁を交互に振り下ろし、細かく切り込むこともある。
sen.e: Sometimes two knifes are used alternately to chop the food into fine pieces.
Sometimes two knifes are used alternately to chop the food into fine pieces.
Sometimes two knifes are used alternately to chop the food into fine pieces.

sen.j: 食材によってはよく刻んだ方がおいしい場合と刻みすぎない方がおいしい場合がある。
sen.e: Depending on the ingredient, some taste better if finely chopped, while others taste better if not chopped too much.
Depending on the ingredient, some taste better if finely chopped, while others taste better if not chopped too much.

sen.j: この方法で調理する食材としては、カツオ、アジ、イサキ、トビウオ、カマス、イワシなどが用いられる。
sen.e: The ingredients used for this cooking method include bonito, Japanese horse mackerel, pigfish, flying fish, Japanese barracuda and sardines.

sen.j: 香草としては、ネギ、ショウガ、シソの葉（大葉）、ニンニクなどが用いられる。
sen.e: Herbs such as scallions, ginger, shiso (beefsteak plant) leaves (oba leaves) and garlic are used.
Herbs such as leeks, ginger, shiso (Japanese basil) and garlic are used.
Herbs such as leeks, ginger, shiso (Japanese basil) and garlic are used.

sen.j: 切り刻むときや食べるときに醤油をたらすことが多い。
sen.e: Soy sauce is often drizzled over the food when it is chopped or when it is eaten.
Soy sauce is often drizzled over the food when it is chopped or when it is eaten.

sen.j: 切り刻むときに味噌を混ぜ、若干の粘り気がでるまでよく刻んだものは「なめろう」と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Those that are mixed with miso when chopping and mixed well until they become slightly sticky are called 'namero.'
Those that are mixed with miso when chopping and mixed well until they become slightly sticky are called 'namero.'

sen.j: 魚ではなく、山菜を粘り気がでるまで細かく切り刻むという料理もある。
sen.e: There are dishes that use sansai (edible wild plants growing in fields and mountains) instead of fish, which are chopped into fine pieces until they become sticky.

sen.j: この場合は香草などは混ぜない。
sen.e: In this case, no herbs are added.
In this case, no herbs are added.

sen.j: 特にミズをたたきにしたものは、秋田県や岩手県などの郷土料理として知られている。
sen.e: In particular, tataki made with lancet fish is known as a local cuisine of Akita Prefecture and Iwate Prefecture.
In particular, tataki made with lancet fish is known as a local cuisine of Akita Prefecture and Iwate Prefecture.

sen.j: アイヌの伝統料理には、サケの氷頭（ひず：頭の軟骨）やエラなどをたたきにし、白子とネギを混ぜて塩で味付けをするという「チタタプ」という料理がある。
sen.e: Among the traditional cuisine of Ainu, there is a dish called 'citatap,' in which salmon hizu (fish head cartilage) and gills are made into a tataki, mixed with soft roe and scallions, and seasoned with salt.

Among the traditional cuisine of Ainu, there is a dish called 'citatap,' in which salmon hizu (fish head cartilage) and gills are made into a tataki, mixed with soft roe and leeks, and seasoned with salt.

Among traditional cuisine of the Ainu, there is a dish called 'citatap,' in which salmon hizu (fish head cartilage) and gills are made into a tataki, mixed with soft roe and leeks, and seasoned with salt.

sen.j: チタタプとはアイヌ語で「たたかれるもの」という意味の言葉である。
sen.e: Citatap is a word that means 'something that is beaten' in Ainu.
Citatap is a word that means 'something that is beaten' in Ainu.
Citatap is a word that means 'something that is beaten' in Ainu.

sen.j: ゴボウやキュウリなどを棒で叩いて組織を崩し、食べやすくすることも「たたき」と呼ばれることがある。
sen.e: The method in which burdock roots or cucumbers are smashed with a rod so as to break up the fibers, making the food easier to eat, can also be called 'tataki.'
The method in which burdock roots or cucumbers are smashed with a rod so as to break up the fibers, making the food easier to eat, can also be called 'tataki.'
sen.cmt: 「組織」は fibers で良いかご確認願います。
